Reviews.Title: “After 3 different stays”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTraveling03
Reviews.Content: This hotel used to be a lot better. We have stayed here now a total of 3 times while visiting Las Vegas. The past time our room was on the first floor and by the garden. The room was infested with large crickets. We did however decide to give the hotel another try and requested 3rd floor and not by the garden. The room this time was infested with Aunts and dirty. The first day on check in there was a peanut and other misc. dirt on the floor. The beds were made but the sheets were dirty. The room a few down had two kegs of beer brought in and people going in and out. There was gang graffit around the property and the area just does not feel safe. The staff were all rude. VERY DIFFERENT than the staff at the La Quinta. The bed mattresses were horrible and hard, my body ached after two nights. I WOULD NOT STAY HERE AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jrpause
Reviews.Content: This hotel has comfortable beds, great tasting full breakfast and an indoor (albeit tiny) indoor pool. Its a great place to stay in Vegas on a budget. For $20 more you can stay at one of the casinos and enjoy huge outdoor pools and Jacuzzis but if you are just passing thru and need a quiet place to sleep you can't beat Microtel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Property!!”
Reviews.Author: JanieDundas
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this "gem" and would highly suggest it to anyone. It has a great location....close to Mandalay Bay and the Strip and there is a great shopping plaza across the street. The hotel is very clean and great for families.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel near the strip.”
Reviews.Author: stephen f
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with kids. The pool was small and no hottub. There is a very small gym. The rooms are small. The price is what you would pay for a much nicer room in a casino/ hotel on the strip. I would not stay here again. The suites are slightly larger than a regular room but only have one bed and a sofa hidabed. It is close to a lot of shopping and some chain restaurants. The service was very good; the staff was very friendly and went out of their way to help with cleaning our room and giving us towels and things. The breakfast was more than most continentals with hot food as well as the usual baked goods. The rooms have fridges, microwaves, and coffee makers. My kids loved it cause there was a pool but I'll choose somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Warm Pool, Clean, Cool Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Matthew F
Reviews.Content: Warm warm pool - great continental breakfast, clean - we liked it. The last time my girlfriend and I were in Las Vegas we stayed at the Venitian. This time, we were driving back from a CA visit with her two kids and wanted a fun place to stay and this place was recommended to us. We called ahead and they told us the pool was WARM - (last little place we stayed in the pool was freezing). Had a great time. I was worried it wasn't going to be clean or there would be something my picky girlfriend wouldn't like, but she lived it. Had a great time with the kids. LOVED the breakfast, and went shopping at the outlets right next door :) First review I have ever written and wanted to do so because we liked it so well :))

Reviews.Title: “ok value, not good neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: ShurleyUSA
Reviews.Content: We were glad to have a good place to sleep after a long travel day. The room was OK, average, clean, with a modern feel, like Hyatt Place, but not as upscale. Breakfast had enough variety but no tables or chairs. We had to sit on a sofa, or chairs holding plate with waffle and syrup, making it notably hard to eat breakfast without getting sticky. The one hesitation I had here was the neighborhood. We did worry about being outside unloading in the dark and wondered about break-ins. Microtels are usually a safe bet for value without having a coupon. ( No casino on this property)

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: michdora
Reviews.Content: About 5 mins walk from Premium Outlets South but since the outlet mall is huge,and the nearest bus stop being on the other side of the outlet, its a 15min walk in total from the bus stop. Transport to town is the Downtown Strip Express at the bus stop, can be a hassle cos u need to take the bus to the terminal in order to take the north bound bus. The motel provide free shuttle to Madalay Bay and the airport as and when you ask for it. There is no fixed schedule. No kettle in the room, the only way to boil water is to use the single cup coffee machine, although they provide a microwave oven, you need to have your own microvable containers. I got a room on the 2nd floor, window facing an airconditoner compressor, you can hear the humming noise, but when the airconditioner in the room is so much louder, you won't mind the compressor noise. I had to switch off the aircon in order to sleep. The pillows are super thin, uncomfortable to sleep with. The hairdryer is not user-friendly, I had to hold it in one hand, and press a blue button on the wall to turn it on, once i let go of the button, the dryer was off. So I couldn't comb and blow dry my hair at the same time cos both hands were occupied. Room is very clean though, no dark spots on carpet or sofa. Toilet and bathtub is clean too. The self-service laundry room comes in handy, $1.50 per usage of the washing machine and dryer. And the hotel seems short of front desk staff. Sometimes when I front desk I had to hold on to it for a long time cos no one picked up the phone.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A JOKE”
Reviews.Author: travelinggal777123
Reviews.Content: if you enjoy GARBAGE, traveling magazine sales and the POLICE this is the spot for you!!!!! stay away from this place it's not safe

Reviews.Title: “Great location for families, but beds uncomfortable.”
Reviews.Author: KonnieAnne
Reviews.Content: Thanksgivings day weekend, petit suite, traveling with 5 mo old. Very good location, under 10 min to almost anywhere in Vegas, lots of food and shopping in the same block. But the bed was very cheap and uncomfortable, will think 2-3 times before staying there again. Staff not overly friendly but not rude. Breakfast simple, but better than cold continental. Great price for a suite though, would recommend to a friend only for price & location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place close to the strip”
Reviews.Author: vasilsev
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel often when coming to work in Vegas. It has nice clean rooms with new beds, a flat screen tv and free internet. It is a great place to stay when coming for work, and you wish to avoid all the big resorts on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice to be close but off Strip”
Reviews.Author: sejarzo
Reviews.Content: Booked via Orbitz package with little advance notice. I needed a guaranteed non-smoking room at a good rate, and was very pleased with this hotel. The room might have smelled a bit fresher, but otherwise was extremely clean and the A/C unit was quiet. Not fancy by any means, but if you are like me and don't plan to be in the room much, it was far more than acceptable for a solo traveler. The hotel is only a mile or so from the LAS rental car facility, and very easy to find if you are unfamiliar and arriving late at night. Quite a few fast food choices are located just across the street in front of the outlet mall, plus there is a large grocery store a few blocks south easily accessed by using the side street just a block east of South Las Vegas Blvd. It would be nice if lobby was a bit larger with a real breakfast room, but I was able to take my food up to my room with no problem. Didn't use the pool area but it did look immaculately clean!

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: tjjg0301
Reviews.Content: Great place and away from the traffic. Staff was awesome. First of all Joey from maintenance was great, he took care of the problem with refrigerator in our room. Then in the morning there was a problem with the waffle maker or batter so pretty much uselesss that morning. Spoke with Joey and he said he would take care of it. The next morning we had another waffle machine and new batter. Second the gentleman at the front desk Tom was very friendly and helpful. He helped us with our room problem so we could enjoy our short stay, then at night the pool was a bit cooler to swim in so Tom turned it up some so we could enjoy it. It's small things like this along with there great personality and attitude that makes us want to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: profH10
Reviews.Content: As a transition from the busy Las Vegas strip, I chose Microtel to continue my weekend stay due to its affordable price. This was a very peaceful place away from the main strip, yet not too far. Staff were courteous upon arrival and departure. My room (last on the first floor) was nice, very clean, provided a small refrigerator and microwave, and was a few steps away from the exit that led to my car outside. It also had a window (facing the patio) with a lovely, cushioned day bench perfect for reading. Even though I did not use it, the breakfast area was appealing and well kept. The small indoor pool goes 4 ft. deep and is perfect for a relaxing swim after exercising in their workout room. Pets are welcome on the first floor. Lots of parking around the hotel. Surrounding area provides an outlet mall right across the street, gas, 7eleven, and many places to eat. I was very pleased and definitely will come back to Microtel for future trips to Vegas. If you want to get away from traffic and noise, I highly recommend Microtel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Helpfull staffs”
Reviews.Author: joecooltoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for the weekend, it was nice , Indoor swimming pool was kind of small but it accommodated what we needed. Staffs were nice, Breakfasts were good enough for the family

Reviews.Title: “As good as Ever”
Reviews.Author: SenorBill
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we have stayed at the Las Vegas Microtel Hotel and we once again highly recommend it. Very attentive management, really nice breakfast each morning, clean and attractive. We travel with our little Chihuahua and she is treated as a guest as well. Plenty of free parking and airport shuttle. Public transportation to the strip if you do not want to drive. The huge Las Vegas Outlet is across the street and almost any restaurant you can think of is just a block or so away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and peaceful hotel, excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: RoelR
Reviews.Content: After staying four days in Las Vegas on the strip and on trip to the Grand Canyon National Park, we decided to stay another night in Vegas whilst on our way to LA. We primarly choose this hotel for it's price (weekends in Vegas are much more expensive) and by its good reviews. Once we arrived a very helpful and friendly man checked us in, and we're given a room on the third floor. It turned out to be a failry large room, with all amenities available. A little kitchenette, couch and good bed. The 24h indoor pool and fitness centre were also a nice surprise. Location of the hotel is right next to the Las Vegas Premium Outlet South. Only thing on this stay that wasn't good was breakfast. There is simply not enough space to sit and enjoy your breakfast. It's not very cosy to eat in the checkin area. Apart from the breakfast, I can recommed to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very acceptable, non-gaming hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4wards
Reviews.Content: My husband and I only stayed one night here in July 2011. We had booked a room with a jacuzzi and although the room was on the small side, it had everything we needed and more. It had the 2-person, side-by-side jacuzzi, a small fridge, microwave, cupboards, small table and 2 chairs and a unique round "chair" which was very comfy. The bathroom was small, but as we were only there one night, it was fine. The hotel room was clean and with the acception of someone pacing above us at 2 in the morning, we found it quiet. The breakfast is acceptable, nothing fancy, bagels, muffins, cereal, make-your-own waffles, etc. There is not a lot of room to eat in the breakfast area, so we just took it back to our room and ate at the small table, which was fine. The main reaon we chose this hotel, other than the price, was its close proximity to the airport, just a short drive away to return the rental car, and then we caught the provided shuttle to the airport. I would definitely stay here again, maybe not when we plan to play the slots, but certainly when going to and coming back from Zion National Park, Utah, which was our main reason for this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Family”
Reviews.Author: WheelingTraveler
Reviews.Content: We got three separate rooms there for our family reunion vacation at LV several days. The beds and interior were great and clean. A mall was close by as well although most attractions require driving in LV. Breakfast was included and took place next to the lobby. There is very limited space there for guests consuming food; so as some others also did, I ended up taking the food upstairs to feed my kids. For the price we paid there can be little complaint. This is a great choice for family trip to LV staying outside the strip,

Reviews.Title: “Great short stay”
Reviews.Author: UtahBrowntrout
Reviews.Content: Clean and quiet room. Bed was very comfortable and the free breakfast was VERY GOOD!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: TracyCMartensville
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over the Memorial day Long Weekend with my 11yr old daughter. I was looking for a non-gaming, no smoking hotel that was easy to access. In previous trips to Vegas (with adults) I have always stayed on strip in the big resort hotels....it always took a minimum of 30 minutes of walking to get to some of the rooms in the larger hotels, plus the time searching for a parking spots in the parkades. I was so delighted that we could park and be up in our room in less than a minute or two with this hotel, it was so much more convenient, especially for anyone travelling with kids. There was the outlet mall directly across the street (2mins walk at most), and several restaurant options in the immediate area. The free breakfast was good, but a little hard to get to on our first couple of mornings since the hotel was full and there were a ton of people gathered in the small area trying to assemble their plates all at the same time. It was much nicer on our third and fourth mornings when the hotel wasn't quite as full. The room was clean and had everything we needed. It was nothing fancy, it's not a 5star resort, but we were just there to sleep so not a big deal. My only complaint was the lighting in the bathroom was much too dark. I would recommend to anyone looking for a no frills, good value, easy access hotel

Reviews.Title: “Clean, New, Inexpensive, Free Breakfast, Away from the strip. Woo Hoo!”
Reviews.Author: TwinCitiesBill
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of the free breakfast and price combination. We were not disappointed. This is a nice new hotel to stay in if you want to get away from the insanity and creepiness that is the Las Vegas strip. It is quiet and laid-back. Nice linens, pillows, comfortable room. We stayed for 5 days and most times we were the only ones in the pool. The free breakfast was tasty and simple (that saves up $15 per day since the two of us don't have to go out to a restaurant). Eggs, sausage, biscuits, pancakes, cold cereals, toast, etc. Note: The front desk guy (I didn't get his name) told me to call ahead next time and he would beat the online prices for a longer stay. That works for me!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: lovinglife12345
Reviews.Content: To begin with, I was a little doubtful about staying here, particularly due to the fact that the hotel allows pets. First of all, I did not here any noise from people's pets. Check in was easy, although the representative at the front desk checking us in, I found to be quite rude and not at all attentive. Apart from that however, we were very happy with our stay. The location was very convenient, close to restaurants and a mall. The decor inside was very nice, rooms were very clean and comfortable. I was very happy with pretty much everything on this stay, an added bonus was that breakfast was available at no additional cost, nothing fancy, but who cares when it's such a good deal. Highly recommend and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel for Families”
Reviews.Author: Angel014
Reviews.Content: We were quite surprised with this hotel. It is located across the South Las Vegas Premium Outlets (it is across the road and we actually walked to the outlet shops). We have stayed in the strip quite a few times before and this hotel is the best for families (especially with young children). The hotel did not have any slot machines which was very welcoming. The hotel was very clean and the colour scheme was inviting. The rooms were clean, comfortable and well maintained. We had a microwave, a fridge and a coffee machine in the room. They provided free Wi-fi and free local calls (anywhere in the US). They also offerred free shuttle to the strip (which we didn't take as we had a hire car). The hotel has an indoor swimming pool - perfect for the kids. They also offerred free breakfast each day. They offerred scrambled eggs, biscuits with gravy, muffins, bread, juice, coffee and the best was the waffles (which you make yourself). If you want to go shopping, this is the best hotel to stay at. My daughter and I spent hours and hours shopping. We would stay here again the next time that we go to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Off Strip Option”
Reviews.Author: castaways01
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights over a weekend before moviing to the strip for a five night stay. Had a rental car so the location was not an issue. My main reason for booking this motel was to escape the high strip prices for a Friday and Saturday night stay. I booked via Hotwire for $53/nt plus tax. Arrived early (10 am) after an international flight and although rooms were available, hotel wanted a half day rack rate to allow me to check in early. I opted to do some errands and check in later. Walls are paper thin and doors slam with a loud bang, so this may be an issue if you are a light sleeper or keep late hours. The room was small but clean. Air Conditioner was loud and came on/off very often. I didn't eat the breakfast or use the indoor pool, so can't comment on that. Easy check in and check out. Would recommend this motel if looking for a budget stay away from the strip. Keep in mind it is "no frills" but a good value with free Internet and phone calls. They make a copy of your credit card and driver's license upon check in which I felt was an invasion of privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast Not As Described,ROOMS NOT BIG,DOUBLE CHARGED!!!”
Reviews.Author: MALA5119
Reviews.Content: I booked for two nights for about $fifty a night because of the free internet and the free FULL HOT breakfast.What a lie that was.At breakfast I realize they only serve sausage when the hotel is full.The cook told me that truth while the front desk clerk lied to me and said they never serve meat at all. Uhhh maybe their website should state that instead of lieing to people. That's not even the half of it.The manager had a nerve to lie to my face.Her first lie was "We only serve a continental breakfast" (False advertisement) Then the next lie she told was "We are only suppose to offer a continental breakfast but we like to offer more than just a continental breakfast for our guests" (False advertisement---website mentions nothing about continental or deluxe continental) Then the last lie she told was the MOTHER of ALL LIES and that was "Well I had some gravy this morning and the meat is chopped up inside" Now I know for a fact that is a lie because I tasted the gravy and unless the meat was purated like baby food, meat was nowhere to be found. I finally had enough of the manager with her lies and bad,unprofessional attitude that we left one night early and then on top of all of that, they had a nerve to double charge me. When I asked them for the corporate phone number, they said there was no corporate phone number and that I could file my complaint against the manager with the manager herself. What kind of crap is that?????!!!!!!! The billing issue didnt get resolved until I actually called the corporate number off their website. i was told I would have to wait 3 days for the manager to respond before anything else could be done.So I went through my bank that same day to get the charge reversed and ......what do you know, they called me back the very next day. BEWARE!!! STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL!!!IT IS TOO FAR FROM THE STRIP AND YOU CAN GET A BETTER HOTEL FOR LESS MONEY AND HEARTACHE

Reviews.Title: “Will certainly stay here again”
Reviews.Author: qpaisa
Reviews.Content: Here's a breakdown of what this hotel is like : Just a background: I have lived at the venetian, flamingo and circus-circus too. The rooms at the venetian and flamingo (after recent renovatoins) are definately glam but I found microtel to be an excellent value for money. The rooms are basic with beds, microwave, little closet, mirrors, large windows etc Pros: free wi-fi, free breakfast, next to tax-free mall, free regular shuttle to the strip, staff extremely courteous, Cons: little away from strip If you are vegas and renting a car.. go for this place. You will not regret. I wold call this one a hidden gem

Reviews.Title: “An out-of-the-way bargain gem”
Reviews.Author: twriter
Reviews.Content: OK, let's get this out of the way first: if you don't have a car with you in Vegas, this place is not for you. It's a good 5 miles south of the center Strip area; you aren't going to walk it and cab fares will really add up. That said, it's a great place to stay if you're not bound for luxury. Nothing about the place screams luxury, but so much screams value. Start with a good size room, a nicely sized flat screen mounted on the wall with way more channels than you're used to in a hotel, free wifi that just plain works, plenty of counter space in the bathroom, and a small fridge and microwave in the room. The staff at check in is friendly and easily answered questions. They always smile when you come in. And get this: a complimentary breakfast buffet. Not just a few stale pastries and coffee. Scrambled eggs (shaped into small pancakes), pancakes, home fries, biscuits and gravy, waffle dough and a waffle iron, oatmeal, toast and bagels, cold cereals and milk, muffins, coffee, tea, iced tea, cranberry juice, and apple juice. I forget, but there may be a bit of fresh fruit. You can start your day hearty, you can start your day healthy, but it's a fabulous way to start your day. And did I mention it's free? Although close to the airport (just south of it, the location gets very little airport noise. It's within walking distance (right across the street) from an outlet mall. And it's easy to get to from the freeway. There's a small indoor pool and a teensy workout room. The workout room reminds me of those I've seen in condo complexes, basically a small closet, albeit window-lined, crammed with a stairmaster, a stationary bike, and an elliptical machine, just so they can say they have a workout room. About the only drawback to the property is that there's no store for amenities and necessities. I found this when I was looking for a bargain place to stay over the first weekend of March Madness, when rooms at the Imperial Palace, the bargain basement of the Harrah's empire, even with the Total Rewards discount, were going for a New Year's Eve-like $100+ per night. For 4 nights here (Thursday through Sunday), I paid a total of $200. No dishonest "resort" fees either; what you are offered is what you pay. It's not a big place, just 3 stories and a couple of different wings. My room was at the end of the hall, and on the top floor, so I heard very little through walls and doors. The cabinetry in the rooms isn't of the highest quality, and the narrow desk in the room was right under the TV, but these are minor quibbles. I saw all sort of travelers here, from spring breakers to single travelers to families. It's a freind;y and accommodating place. Unlike just about every hotel, bar, restaurant, convenience store, grocery store, etc., this hotel has zero gambling machines. So the clientele comes here for the hotel amenities alone. Like the Clarion around the corner from Encore, this turns out to be another hidden Vegas gem. I'm not sure it reaches the "4 star" level in terms of typical hotel ratings, but it definitely deserves it for what it does offer at the "star" level it places itself in. I mean, if you were to look on Priceline of Hotwire or Expedia or Kayak or other hotel and consolidator sites, it'd likely be considered to be somewhere around 2, 2.5, or maybe 3 stars. Which according to their rating system would be about right. But in that range, this hotel shines. With all if offers, unless you need to be on the strip, for sheer value, this is a place to consider.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, but great value”
Reviews.Author: majigail
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for less than $60 per night so we we're expecting a lot. I was really impressed by the staff's friendliness and with the cleanliness of the place. The meeting rooms were nice and everything was set up how we asked. It was convenient to the outlet mall and a few restaurants (be sure to ask for the free bottle of wine across the street at Bootleggers). The onsite breakfast is good too. Its about a $20 cab ride to the strip, but they do offer a shuttle during the day. Don't forget to bring your own toiletries, that's the only other place they lack in.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: Here There and Everywhere
Reviews.Content: Arriving late by air, this was the perfect place for us ... Convenient to the airport, reasonable rates, spacious room, friendly front desk staff ... Got a great night's sleep and had an enhanced continental breakfast that included hot items (no fruit, however). The clientele looked sharp, too, mostly couples and families.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, beyond my expectation”
Reviews.Author: pooh_bear_tx
Reviews.Content: We are a family of two adults and two teens. We paid $53.72 (including tax) for one Saturday night. What a great value!! When I checked in, the front desk lady tried to photocopy of my credit card and driver's license, which raised my concern. I used American Express card with the security code printed on the front of the card. I told her that I do not feel comfortable to let her make a copy, she then did not do it. The room was clean. It was not big but enough for our family. Very quiet. Internet speed was fast! The complimentary hot breakfast was very delicious, although the sitting area was odd. The staff was constantly checking and restocking the food. This hotel really went beyond my expectation! Great value!

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: andcondeb
Reviews.Content: would definately stay here again, infact we did, we had a fly drive and this was our 1st hotel stop off, we stayed 3 nights, excellent value , rooms were clean, staff lovely, breakfast was brill, it was a good start to our holiday. we travelled round sanfransisco then los angeles then back to vegas to fly home , we really enjoyed it there so we booked back in for our last 3 days , we had the pool to ourselves,breakfast was cereal, tea, coffee, apple juice, pancakes, eggs, muffins bagels, kids could make their own waffles and could add choc chips n raisens which was lovely, they serve fresh coffee on lobby all day, quite location just off strip and next to shopping outlet for bargains galore, just up the road is town square with designer shops and lovely restaurants, would definately recommend and would stay there again ,

Reviews.Title: “Good motel, convenient for the airport”
Reviews.Author: Warleggan1
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night at this motel after a long weary flight from England. After enduring the hard sell at the Alamo car rental desk, it was en easy short drive from the Car Rental centre to the motel. Check in was quick. The room, a double queen, was spacious, clean, the wifi worked fine, and the beds were comfortable. The breakfast was OK by motel standards. The motel is located on the outskirts, south of town. Because we headed away from Vegas in the morning, can't comment on getting to and from the strip. Overall this was a good reasonably priced motel.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Wilrosmith
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel. We arrived very early and the front desk clerk and staff were very friendly. Even allowed us to check-in early. The hotel was clean, quiet and comfortable. Wi-Fi is everywhere in this hotel. You can connect from your hotel room which we really appreciated. Not all hotels have this. Sometimes you have to go to the lobby to connect. Breakfast was very good. Great variety. And this place is not too far from the strip. If you rent a car, it's only at most 10 minutes with traffic if that. But if you're travelling by bus or taxi, do some research. But we STRONGLY recommend you don't use a taxi because they cost wayyyy too much! Costed us $20 to ride from airport to this hotel which is only 2-3 miles away! You spend far less money traveling by bus, but it will take you longer to get there. Either way, put on some comfortable shoes because you will do some walking on the strip. Also when it gets late, the bus doesn't go to a stop near this hotel. There are two stops near this hotel, both by different buses. My wife and I had to walk late one night about 3-4 miles on the streets because no one told us this. Which brings me to the only thing we didn't like about the hotel. The front desk clerk didn't know anything about the buses. Not where the bus stops were, when they came, cost, nothing! She was very friendly, but not very informative. We went to the nearby outlet mall and got more information from the information clerk there than the hotel clerk. You probably can pick up a bus schedule there too. That info could have saved us time and a very long walk late that night. Other than that, we would come back.

Reviews.Title: “This place is all love... <3”
Reviews.Author: inaplasticcup
Reviews.Content: Came into Vegas a day earlier than planned and walked into an (almost) fully booked hotel save one room, which was not available because housekeeping had missed. I begged Elaine at the front desk for the room and offered to change the linens and scrub the toilets myself. She gave me the room and came up with me to change the linens. She even adjusted my rate for the inconvenience of watching her change the linens. :P Breakfast included with a make-it-yourself waffle iron, a player piano, free wi-fi, an indoor saltwater pool, eco-friendly practices, and people empowered to give you what you need. If you've never stayed at an efficiency, to judge this against full service hotels is really an apples to oranges comparison. If you believe in service from the heart with an eye toward conservation and efficiency, this is a great place to stay. Highest recommendation. :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value, and we will return”
Reviews.Author: paspee_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed only for 1 night, as we were unable to secure our hotel on the strip for our first night. The staff were so friendly on checking in, could not have been more helpful! We had a large room with 2 double beds, plus another small matress as we were there with 3 children. Room was plenty big enough, with coffee maker, fridge & microwave. As it was off the strip, there was no noise overnight from traffic, and we all slept very well. We had dinner at the Bootlegger next door, which was very good. Breakfast was a little awkward to eat as there were no tables, however, it was a bonus as we didn't realise this was included in the price of the room, and it set us up for the day! Pool was quite small, but clean and the kids loved it. Small outside courtyard where we sat in the evening with a couple of beers, again, it was clean and very nice. Parking was right outside the door, without any trouble finding parking spaces as we found at the next hotel we stayed at on the strip. We would stay here again next time without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad at All”
Reviews.Author: rara111
Reviews.Content: This is the first time that I did not stay in a casino/resort/hotel in Vegas and I was pleasantly surprised. After factoring in the cost of resort and internet fees, I could not find a place that compared to the Microtel and still met my needs. The room was clean and the decor on the funky side. The bed was very comfortable and there was a small counter area, complete with sink, microwave, fridge and coffee maker, that divided the bed from the sitting area that contained a small table and chairs, sofa and coffee table. The lighting was excellent in all parts of the room. This hotel is next door to a huge outlet mall and just down the road from the Southpoint Casino..it is also close to a number of restaurants, fast food places and other shopping. The front desk staff were pleasant and the area felt safe. It is only about a mile from the strip and you can see Mandalay Bay from this location. The only things one should be aware of are the thin walls (you can hear people talking); the unorthodox breakfast area (there are no tables); the location of the television (on the wall between the bed and sitting area) and in my case, the sofa needed the supports repaired. The internet worked flawlessly and was free; no resort fees; a pool; and close enough to a number of casino's to fill that void. This place is value for the money and I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great waffles at breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Kagakiwi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights, then at Caesars Palace for two, so this review will be in light of the larger and more famous (and expensive) place. The room I had booked on the net was not available, due to not being a room type at this particular inn, but Tom on the front desk bent over backwards to ensure we got a room that matched our requirements, upgrading us to a junior suite. Reception far smoother and friendlier than Caesars - no half-hour queue for a start. The room was quiet and clean, though the connecting door to the next door room would not lock. Despite an assurance this would be taken care of, it was not. A minor issue, as we were told that the room would not be let out during our stay (Vegas in the off season I guess). The free buffet breakfasts were superb, with a variety of both savoury and sweet. The make-your-own waffles were the highlight. The only problem was that the dining area was a little cramped, so we usually took ours to our room. Anyone who has stayed in the massive Strip hotels will appreciate that from our room to our car was thirty seconds walk. I never imagined this would be an issue, but it was. The location is good: just off the southern part of the Strip, almost walkable from the rental car place, opposite the Outlet Mall and a short drive from a cheap Food 4 Less supermarket. Nice and quiet too. Would I stay here again? Without hesitation. It cost less for five nights than CP did for two, and offered more.

Reviews.Title: “Will NOT stay there again!!”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoRetired09
Reviews.Content: Microtel was well worn and dirty... reserved mini suite for 2 nights... Furniture in lobby worn and hallway dirt. In our mini suite the sofa had stains... did not want to sit on it... kitchen sink had something gross in it -- had to clean it.. food left in the refrigerator from previous customer. Suite's furniture worn and could write you name in the dust on the coffee table and small eating table. Were given 2 -onecup- coffee packets.. one reg coffee and one decaf. We used them on the first day - they were not replenished - so no coffee the second morning.. No Chairs or Tables in the breakfast room... only small sofas and small coffee tables to eat at...Very uncomfortable. On Sunday morning the few sofas in the "breakfast" room were occupied so we took our breakfast to the ajoining lobby... There we observed a scruffy person approach the check-in counter and tell the employee he locked himself out of his room 105. We watched the clerk issue him a new room key without asking his name or checking his ID... this is scary.. Oh yes, I forgot to mention the barking dog in the room next to ours...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay off the strip”
Reviews.Author: friendly_fire22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January for 2 weeks and it was an excellent place to stay. The rooms were very clean and confortable, the tv and cable was great, there was a fridge and microwave, plus the best shower you will find at a hotel! Full hot breakfast every day and excellent services in the hotel. It is not walking distance to the strip, but we prefer that. It is only a 5 min drive though, but the distance makes it quiet and safe. It was opposite the las vegas outlet stores which was also a bonus, and is very close to the airport ($15 cab ride). They also allow pets which i think is excellent. The bed was comfortable and we slept well every night. One night there were kids running around, but we rang downstairs and they fixed it right away. There is an Italian resturant and bar across the road which was nice, plus there were takeaway places and resturants a short walk away including Chilis. The staff were excellent. I would highly recommend staying there for anyone, but especially if you want a cheaper, less gaudy, quiet, understated and comfortable place to stay away from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay A++++++++++”
Reviews.Author: bigdinca
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Vegas and don't want to pay the jacked up rates for a hotel stay here, its only 2 miles from the strip down Las Vegas Blvd. I stayed here 01-07 - 11-10 and everything was great. I don't know what the deal with the "poor customer service" came from other reviewer but The hotels I have stayed at in the last couple of years that is the new norm. The check in was smooth and fast, staff was very helpful and assisted me with all my questions and directions when needed at all hours. The rooms are great, lots of room and the beds are super nice, very good sleep. The HDTV'S are nice and the internet is super fast, fastest connection I have ever had at a hotel. I downloaded a movie, 1.36 GB in under 10 mins. I don't know about the food as I never went down but heard some people in the lobby during checkout staying it was good If you don't mind staying off the strip or driving 2 miles to it stay here, you will not think twice about staying here. I cant wait to go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great family type hotel with indoor heated pool!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MyPrairieGirl
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a good non gaming, non smoking, no reort fee hotel with an indoor heated (kinda) pool with free breakfast, microwave, coffeemaker and refrig this is it! It isn't 100 stories tall either, so you don't feel lost in it. It's just a little south on the strip road and very very convenient to the airport and rental car return. The beds are really nice. The free breakfast was good but they don't have any tables, just coffee tables so you could take it back to your room or try to eat off the coffee table. The bathroom was a little small but it did have a bathtub and a seperate switch for the exhaust fan and light. There isn't much of a sound barrier between rooms so we just let the fan run all night, creating that 'white' noise and we slept soundly. Checkout was a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag, Wish the AC worked.”
Reviews.Author: srp2007
Reviews.Content: Rooms have the necessary amenities but were kind of too small. Pillows were too Soft for me. The biggest problem for me was the AC did not work continuously which made my stay quite uncomfortable. On speaking to the front desk, they acknowledged the problem and said they did not have central AC and the room ACs need to be energy efficient as per government regulations. Still I had a difficult time understanding how the ACs would shut off when the room was still hot. Good things here were smoke-free policy, free breakfast and wifi (excellent speed), good service (especially BJ at front desk). Location wise it was OK. There are groceries and starbucks close by, but note that it can take up to 25 minutes to get to the Bellagio area on the strip during evening time. A minor point about the decor, probably I expected too much from other reviews it was just OK and not great (for me).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel PLUS Great Rate!”
Reviews.Author: bradleykim
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooms a bit on the small side, but has everything you could need - especially nice linens, furniture, and decor. The room was very clean, though for a non-smoking hotel, the room smelled like it had been smoked in. This cleared as soon as we started the air conditioner . We stayed in the "new" wing on the top floor and couldn't hear anyone else the whole time. The free breakfast was hot, good and plentiful. It included hot pancakes, potatoes, eggs, and we saw people with bacon, though it was not available when we ate. The breakfast also had cereal, muffins, toast, juice, coffee, etc. Only thing missing in my opinion was fruit. We love the free high-speed wireless internet. We also loved the indoor pool (though it was a bit on the cold side for our 2 little girls). The location was about 1-2 miles from the strip. It was just fine for us because we were just passing through on our way to California, but if you are there to "do" the strip, I would recommend staying on the strip itself. If you're just looking for a great night 's stay, this is the place! In addition to being a great hotel, the price was great ! We couldn't have been happier with our stay! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could clone this hotel and price everywhere!”
Reviews.Author: Babs_ohio
Reviews.Content: We used this facility for one night at the start of our two week trip and again for two nights at the end. We had a room on the 3rd floor on first night and 1st floor on the second stay, both times we had NO problems with noise. Both time, our room was very clean. Beds very comfortable. It is very convenient to the car rental center and to the Duece bus transit center. We are from a small town and dislike busy and congested traffic, as on the strip in Vegas. This hotel allowed us to fly in late, pickup a car, check in, relax and get to bed (without going through a crowded and smoky casino). Desk gave us a small map upon request of where we could pick up a few snacks and a couple beers before settling in for the night. A great market was only a couple blocks away, with minimal traffic in a new city. If you are looking for a wild time, smoke and traffic you can probably find cheaper accomodations on the strip. On our second stay we arrived late in the afternoon, after driving all day in from Moab UT and found a great and reasonable buffet at the South Point Casino. This is south a few blocks from the microtel (and again, away from the traffic on the north strip) and it was delicious! We ate at South Point both of our two dinners in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and Cozy not far from main strip”
Reviews.Author: isaiahsmommy82
Reviews.Content: Nicely priced, clean, comfy, pet friendly hotel only minutes from the main hubub of the strip

Reviews.Title: “Clean, updated and great breakfast, returning soon!”
Reviews.Author: Funinthesun044
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April while my husband worked in Las Vegas. The room was clean, updated and everything in working order. Breakfast had everything we could think of, eggs, sausage, potatos, fruit, and waffles (also has cereal and bread). The pool is nothing fancy, but clean & certainly adequate with an outside sunning area. A huge shopping Outlet Mall is next door *about a block's walk. Staff was cordial but businesslike. This place seems an excellent 'home away from home' for the price ($69/night) and we are going back in May.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: mahalVEGAS2
Reviews.Content: last minute decision to go to vegas. I guess it was a busy weekend coz almost every hotel is booked. So we ended up staying here. never heard of this hotel before. free internet and breakfast. wow! but for about $165/tax??? not sure..check in is at 3pm but the front desk let us in the rm before then. It was a hot day so I gave my 2 kids a bath. 5 & 3yrs old. There were 3 towels in the rm. Used 2 so down to 1. I took a shower after so all the towels are wet. I called the front desk to request for new towels. I was asked how many so i told her 2. I waited and waited. even prepared $2 for tip. 7pm comes, still no towels. so I jst let it go. I hung the towels so we could use them again. Went out to eat. In the am, I was really looking forward to having a big breakfast. I was gambling til 3am so i woke up about 9:30am. got ready to go eat. 10:15am i go out... Guess what??? No more food outside. breakfast is till 11am and its a buffett!!! So i asked the guy who was cleaning the eating place what happened to the food. "no habla engles" is what i got. so i was giving him sign language and all he can tell me was "maniana" whick means tomorrow. DANG!!! So all I got from there was coffee. not that hot anymore so i decided to make one in the rm but the coffee maker was so dirty. I was jst pissed off already that we jst had to check out right away. never staying here again!

HotelInfo.Name: Microtel Inn & Suites Las Vegas
HotelInfo.Address: 55 E. Robindale Road, Las Vegas, NV 89123
